Description: You enter your office, and sit down by your desk. You place the wand in front of you, looking wide-eyed at it. You have never felt the precence of such a powerful object before.

The broken part is barely hanging on by a few black threads, or... pieces of hair. You trace the shape of the wand, over the small spheres that are disturbing the, otherwise ordinarily looking, wand-shape.

Options.Name: Look for more information in the library
Ask the Charms professor for help

Description: You hide the wand in your office and head towards the library. Witch section should you go to for answers?
You read several books in the Magical Creatures section without luck, until you come across a chapter about thestrals.
You find out that thestral tail hairs have been, though rarely, used as cores in wandmaking. Although, a wand with such core would only be mastered by a wielder capable of accepting death.
You read several books in the History of Magic section without luck, until you come across a chapter about the Battle of Hogwarts.
You read the story of the Battle of Hogwarts.
You read several books in the Herbology section without luck, until you come across a chapter about elderwood.
You find out that elderwood is the rarest wand wood known, and that it is known to only choose a highly unusual person as their wielder.
You put the wand in your robe again and head towards Mrs Malfoys office.
